text:
Kolor:  Czarny, praktycznie nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  W takim szkle trudno spodziewaƒá siƒô jakiej≈õ poka≈∫nej piany. Na takie warunki my≈õlƒô, ≈ºe jest nie≈∫le. Piana ma be≈ºowy kolor i niskƒÖ strukturƒô.
Nie≈∫le radzi sobie p≈ÇywajƒÖc po powierzchni trunku.
Piana pozostawia doskona≈Çy lacing na szkle. 
 Zapach:  Fenomenalny aromat! PoczƒÖtkowo daje po nosie intensywna czekolada deserowa, mn√≥stwo nut kakao i melasy. Pod spodem du≈ºo karmelu, wafelk√≥w ≈õmietankowych, a tak≈ºe aromat andruta z masƒÖ kakaowƒÖ.
Ca≈Ço≈õƒá przypieczƒôtowuje nie jaka≈õ gigantyczna, ale do≈õƒá mocna wo≈Ñ bourbonu i mokrego drewna. 
 Smak:  W smaku piwo jest przede wszystkich kawowe. Intensywnie kawowe z najlepszej jako≈õci kawƒÖ.
Jest tak≈ºe umiarkowana palono≈õƒá od kawy, a za niƒÖ gorzka czekolada.
Na jƒôzyku przewijajƒÖ siƒô r√≥wnie≈º nuty orzech√≥w laskowych i andruta z masƒÖ kakaowƒÖ.
Po ogrzaniu wychodzi odrobinƒô cierpkich owoc√≥w, z kt√≥rych najmocniej daje o sobie znaƒá. wi≈õnia.
Piwo jest nisko wysycone o gƒôstej zbitej teksturze.
Beczka jest zr√≥wnowa≈ºona, nienachalna.
Posmak bourbonu i mokrego drewna stanowi idealne dope≈Çnienie ca≈Ço≈õci.
Alkohol zmia≈ºd≈ºony lewym sierpowym, kompletnie niezauwa≈ºalny.
Odczucie w ustach g≈Çadkie, kremowe, delikatne.
Same superlatywy ;) 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Genialny Imperial Porter! 
Pytanie ch≈Çopk√≥w z Mikkellara brzmia≈Ço, czy Brian jest w stanie i czy znokautuje George¬ía?
W moim odczuciu definitywnie tak!
Brian to co prawda inny styl, 
ale jako≈õƒá i balans jest o niebo lepszy.
Mamy tutaj masƒô nut czekoladowych, kakao, orzech√≥w, wi≈õni, melasy oraz andruta z masƒÖ kakaowƒÖ.
Beczka po bourbonie rewelacyjnie komponuje siƒô z piwem bazowym dajƒÖc umiarkowane akcenty dƒôbiny, mokrego drewna w kombinacji z szlachetnych alkoholem.
Uczta dla moich kubk√≥w smakowych! ;)

URUS 3.0
Aroma: milk chocolate, vanilla, red fruits, marshmallows, caramel
Taste: Medium to heavy sweet, milk chocolate, vanilla, sweet cherry, marshmallows, toffee
Pite na Urusie. Genialne piwo. W smaku i zapachu zbalansowana kawa, czekolada, wanilia, owoce. Pe≈Çne a jednocze≈õnie pijalne. Alku brak.

Butelka 330ml. Piwo czarne, nieprzejrzyste z brƒÖzowym ko≈ºuszkiem, kt√≥ry opadajƒÖc wyra≈∫nie osadza siƒô na szkle. Aromat jest ob≈Çƒôdny, czekoladowy z beczkowƒÖ nutƒÖ delikatnie s≈Çodkiej wanilii, po prostu poezja i ani krzty alkoholu. W smaku gorzka czekolada prze≈Çamana nutƒÖ s≈Çodkiej wanilii i bardzo subtelnym kwaskiem na samym finiszu co daje delikatnie wytrawne, lekko drewniane na poczƒÖtku i s≈Çodkie, nawet ciut za bardzo, na finiszu, mega g≈Çadkie piwo o oleistej, wrƒôcz gƒôstej konsystencji i ≈õwietnie ukrytym alkoholu, kt√≥ry tylko i wy≈ÇƒÖcznie delikatnie rozgrzewa od ≈õrodka, poza tym jest niewyczuwalny. PodsumowujƒÖc, ≈õwietny s≈Çodki, nawet bardzo s≈Çodki ale nie ulepkowaty porter, bardzo dobrze zbalansowany z genialnymi nutami beczki.

Bottle thanks to Nikos, apparently via Poland and Greece to make it to me :). Pours opaque black, small tan head, dissipates fairly quickly, great lacing. Aroma is cocoa, molasses, bourbon, hints of tobacco. Flavor is fully sweet, medium bitter. Full bodied and creamy mouthfeel. Quite good tasting.

330 ml bottle. The pour is deep black with a thin, transient head of tan froth. The aromas burst out of the bottle with perfumes of dark chocolate, roasted malts and sweet, dried fruits. Taste is heavy, thick and chewy, dried fruits - think of prunes raisins and cherries, mixed with a rich dark chocolate and roasted malts. The bourbon booziness mixes well with the flavours to give a cloying, lingering sweetness. This one is a sipper, even though the mildness of the carbonation makes you want desperately to gulp it all down in one go! The mouthfeel is oily and slick, coating the mouth with all the flavours for a lingering, sweet finish.

Aromat jest ≈õwietny, bardzo du≈ºo kokosa i wanilii. W smaku r√≥wnie≈º podobnie z tƒÖ r√≥≈ºnicƒÖ ≈ºe s≈ÇodkƒÖ wanilie i kokos w pierwszej chwili kontruje lekko rozgrzewajƒÖcy alkohol, a p√≥≈∫niej na jƒôzyku przez d≈Çugi czas rozchodzi siƒô kakao. Bardzo fajny balans. C√≥≈º tu du≈ºo m√≥wiƒá, ≈õwietne piwo.

mistrzowski porter wyle≈ºakowany w bourbonie, tym≈ºe burbonem przenikniƒôty do szpiku piwnej ko≈õci, przez co purystom mo≈ºe byƒá niemi≈Çy, ale jest to tak diablo smaczne, ≈ºe nie spos√≥b siƒô oprzeƒá. wart ka≈ºdej ceny.
moc czekolady, kakao i wanilli. Gƒôste, oleiste i nieprzejrzyste. Beczka. Alkohol- volt konkretny, jednak schowany tak, ≈ºe wychodzi gdzie≈õ dopiero pod koniec degustacji w prze≈Çyku. fajne

Kurwe≈Çe jakie to dobre. Aromat typowy dla beczki po burbonie, do tego trochƒô czekolady. W smaku zaskakujƒÖco ma≈Ço s≈Çodko, sporo palono≈õci. Minusem piana i zbyt ma≈Ço intensywny aromat beczki. Ale to szczeg√≥≈Çy. Super piwo, szkoda ≈ºe cena nie jest super :).
Czarne, nieprzejrzyste z bujnƒÖ, gƒôstƒÖ, be≈ºowƒÖ pianƒÖ. Genialny aromat beczki, jest wanilia, czekolada, kokos. WyklejajƒÖce, gƒôste. Wybitne piwo.

Comparing to regular version strong bourbon, vanilla, coconut and oaky accents. Almostly noticed from the beginning and perfectly match into baseline of this beer character - full of red and black dried fruits (raisins, prunes). Highly drinkable, thick and creamy texture, chocolate and sweet. Slightly ABV warming in the end, after some time in the glass - just slight pinching. This is how imperial porter should look like, big brew.

Kolor: czarny, nieprzejrzysty.
Piana: niska, drobnopƒôcherzykowa, niezbyt trwa≈Ça.
Zapch: intensywny aromat ciemnych, palonych s≈Çod√≥w, gorzkiej czekolady, kakao, kawy, pralin czekoladowych, r√≥wnie≈º sporo aromat√≥w bourbona, beczki, drewna, ani ≈õladu alkoholu.
Smak: spora pe≈Çnia, g≈Çadkie, aksamitne, intensywne nuty palonych s≈Çod√≥w, gorzkiej czekolady, kakao, kawy, do≈õƒá wyra≈∫na s≈Çodycz, sporo nut bourbona, beczki, wyra≈∫na goryczka, palona, delikatna kwaskowo≈õƒá od ciemnych s≈Çod√≥w oraz beczki, alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty, niewyczuwalny.
Wysycenie: niskie.

Wybitne piwo, jedno z moich ulubionych od Mikkellera. Ever. Gƒôste, kremowe. Aromat fantastyczny: wanilia, bourbon, czekolada, tona ciemnych owoc√≥w, toffi, kokos. W smaku w zasadzie powt√≥rzenie aromat√≥w, na s≈Çodko. Oleiste, wyklejajƒÖce, ze znakomicie u≈Ço≈ºonym alkoholem.

November 12, 2016. Bottle at home. Black with a tiny tan head that quickly dissipates and leave a small ring around the glass. Aroma is malty and roasted with cocoa, roasted coffee, ash, soy, sweet notes of toffee, bourbon, hints of wood. Taste is medium sweet, smooth bitter and slightly salty. Medium to full bodied, smooth texture, soft carbonation. Lingering finish with dry ash and cocoa, slight salty soy notes, hints of dark berries, toffee and warming bourbon alcohol. 
Good, perhaps a bit too much ash and salty in the finish.

Nice brown head. Absolutely fantastic aroma of Bourbon, vanilla, licorice, sweet chocolate, smoked plums, wood, caramel. Intensive and complex. Taste is similar as aroma, but additionaly little sour. Full body, extremely well hidden alcohol. Great porter.

Naso meraviglioso con tortino al cacao, bourbon, frutta rossa, vaniglia, il giusto tocco legnoso a ricordare come la birra abbia vissuto tempo in botte. In sottofondo riminiscenze di tabacco e caffe, per un aroma pi√π elegante che intenso, ma davvero invitante. Nera impenetabrile con una schiuma fine e compatta che abbandona presto il bicchiere per lascisre qualche vago cerchio color nocciola. Imbocco molto dolce, la birra √® liscia e parte con sapori forti di caff√® e cioccolato, tortino alla frutta, tanta frutta secca in sottofondo, piacevole, prima di lasciare spazio alla dolcezza della vaniglia e al calore del bourbon. La birra √® molto equilibrata, partendo dolce ed evolvendo piacevolmente. Il bourbon si sente ma mitiga bene cacao e vaniglia. La parte migliore √® sicuramente il retrogusto, ricco e avvolgente. Oleosa, a tratri setosa, sicuramente non possente ma ancora una volta elegante e ben fatta.

Bue en bouteille. Superbe produit. Couleur noir profond, belle mousse beige fonc√©, √©paisse. Nez moka, alcool, f√ªt et une pointe de chocolat. Palais excellent, du corps, de la rondeur, longue en bouche. Moka, caramel, bourbon, tout y est, parfaitement √©quilibr√©. Excellent.

Bue en bouteille de 33cl √† la brasserie,
Couleur noire, mousse marron et pointe effervescente
Nez sur le caramel et la vanille
Attaque caram√©lis√©e, puis la vanille c√¥t√© bois√©e vanille du bourbon avec une pointe torr√©fi√© en fin de bouche excellente.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Pours jet black with a thick brown, like used engine oil. Smell of dark malts, chocolate sauce, vanilla, oak and bourbon. Heavy sweet, cocoa, vanilla, bourbon, oak, good flavors, the mouthfeel is somewhat still thin. Alot of roast and toast, with a touch of ash. Not up there with George i¬ím afraid

Bottle shared by Mart, thanks! Very dark brown beer, small brown head. Nose is roast, bourbon, dark fruit, booze. Flavor is vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, roast, dried fruit. Finishes with vanilla, woody notes and booze. Lingering roast, slight acidity.

Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours dark brown-black. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, malt, roast. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, dark chocolate, vanilla, malt, bit acidic. Covers alcohol rather well. Finish is roast bitter with some alcohol. Overall: good.

330ml bottle (thanks Mart). Pitch black color. Tiny size, brown head, disappears. Sweet, plums, caramel, woody, bourbon in aroma. Smells fantastic. Prunes, dark chocolate, vanilla, caramel and bourbon in taste. Tiny bit of alcoholic. Prunes and bourbon in aftertaste. Nice balance. Excellent brew.
Svart med null skum. Aroma av vanilje, rom/bourbon, r√∏stet malt og noe sjokolade. Smaken er mye samme, deilig vanilje og t√∏rket frukt. Tykk konsistens.
Bottle. Dark brown color. Aroma: barrel, caramel, corn, spirits, very good. Taste: oily, bourbon, corn alcohol, candy, dried fruits, oak, vanilla. Great one.

Heavy and exquisite taste of coffee and chocolate. The same applies to the fragrance. Even a heavy bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Lovely and enjoyable beer. Follow me @ Kung av √∂l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Smell of red berries, bourbon, oak. Black colour, very dark brown head. Aroma of oak, rum, alcohol, licorice, red berries. Bitter, also sweet. Very flat carbon, oily texture, very heavy body.

Bottle at Taps Beer Bar, Mont Kiara. Poured a clear dark brown colour with a thin whispy tan head. The aroma is rich sweet malt, red berry fruits, chocolate, alcohol, coconut. The flavour is moderate to strong sweet with a big rich oily sweet malt, chocolate coffee alcoholic bitter palate. Full bodied with flat carbonation.

A black beer with a huge dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, alcohol, bourbon, and coffee. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, chocolate, roasted malt, bourbon, and raisins, leading to a dry roasted finish.

33cl bottle. Pitch black pour, visibly thick and oily, with a thin espresso head that gives way to a bit of lacing. Smells like bourbon barrel, toffee, vanilla, sherry. The taste follows the same notes, with bourbon up front, but not as heavy as the nose suggested - which is good - followed by cherries, barrel sourness, vanilla, cold brewed coffee, sherry, roasted malts, chocolate. Full bodied with a sticky-smooth mouthfeel and a bitter-sweet aftertaste.

Czarne, s≈Çaba brƒÖzowa piana kt√≥ra dosyƒá szybko znika, w aromacie przede wszystkim bourbon, przy mocniejszym zaciƒÖgniƒôciu alkohol ale to akceptowalne przy takim procencie, przy picu czuƒá g≈Ç√≥wnie kawƒô, trochƒô te≈º jakby waniliƒô, troszeczkƒô nut bourbonu-whisky, je≈õli chodzi o smaki to na poczƒÖtku s≈Çodycz, pojawia siƒô kawowa kwaskowo≈õƒá, goryczki chmielowej brak, dosyƒá gƒôste przez co pi≈Çem powoli, bardzo dobre piwo
backlog. bottle. Jet black with a small brown head. Aroma has loads of roast, subtle vanilla and mocha. Rich with a roasted finish. Nice

330ml bottle, vertical with Brian. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, salty licorice, hints of bourbon, buttery notes, wood, oak, vanilla, coffee and chocolate. Taste is smooth, sweet and bourbony with some salty licorice, oak, wood, vanilla, coffee and chocolate. Finish is smooth, sweetish and bourbony with some licorice, wood, oak and vanilla. Slightly better than the regular version. Good.

330 ml bottle. Pours a black colour without a head. Aroma of rich dark roastiness, tart wood, a bit of plums and herbal notes. Flavour of rich dark roastiness, soy sauce, grassy bitterness, a bit of bourbon, rough wooden notes and chocolate. Full bodied. Quite dry mouthfeel. Straightforward.

33 cl bottle @ home
Vertical with Brian BA
Aroma is somewhat mild with sweet licorice tones, bourbon and mild wood. 
Also mild chlorine tones. Flavour has whiskey, salty licorice, peaty tones and mild ashy notes. Slightly more rich and (thus) better than basic Brian.

33 cl bottle. (vertical with "base" Brian)
Pours black color with a small beige head. Bourbon-y aroma with an interesting vanilla and barrel notes, sweet caramel and milky chocolate. Flavor is strong vanilla and bourbon, dark chocolate, coffee notes and bitterness. Quite nice.
5425

330ml bottle served in regular glass. Purchased at Craftissimo - Hong Kong.
A: Pours a deep oily black color forming a medium creamy solid beige head when poured. Medium retention forming and leaving some lingring and molasses 
S: Sweet nose. Strong notes of dark chocolate and bourbon. Roasted malts and licorice. Oak. Alcohol.
T: Sweet upfront. Strong notes of dark chocolate, toffee, caramel malts, roasted malts, oak, bourbon, licorice and dark dry fruits. Strong bitter finish, strong notes of roasted malts and grassy hops. Boozy finish.
M: Heavy molasses body. Low carbonation. Toffee, dark chocolate and bourbon in the aftertaste.
O: Great drinkability. Masterpiece.

wyglƒÖd jak na piwo z beczki bdb
aromat beczka, wanilia poziom x1000, do tego ≈õliwka w czekoladzie, kawa, no petarda
smak gƒôste, lepiƒÖce, posmak kawowy kwa≈õny, trochƒô ciemne owoce
PodsumowujƒÖc og√≥lnie to bardzo dobre piwo, pijƒô je ju≈º ktory≈õ raz i zawsze jestem zadowolony, po prostu trzeba wypiƒá
The first bottle shared at TheArtofTea place. 10.03.2016. Dark brown with mininal head. Coffee-chocolate aromas, rich, thick, deep, good balanced of sweet, bitter and salty.

Very dark brown, silky tan ringed head. Spotty lacing. Nose is dusty choc and nippy blackberry roast before a sweet coconut good time. Initial taste is a rich, soft peppery and scrapes of tarry coconut. Carbonation is middling and mouthfeel rich and pillowy roast. Finishes meaty and sweet - no complaints here. Lingers a moreish cackle of sweetness and swift enough roast.Bottle fae Stu666, Pig Out Tasting.
Pours opaque black with frothy brown head. Aroma is cocoa, bourbon, vanilla, oak, leather, raisins. Taste is vanilla, oak, leather, milk chocolate, raisins, molasses. Full body
Bottle at craig¬ís. Pours black, nose chocolate, oak, fairy liquid, taste is sweet, chocolate, oak, vanilla, light roasted malts.

Bottle at home... Dark black.. Thin tan lacing... Dark chocolate roast... Big sweet chocolate roast nose.. Dark chocolate.. Rich chocolate roast.. Big chocolate roast.. Hig berries roast... Rich real chocolate.. Wow

Lukt: </bFrukter, kaffe, lakris, bek og m√∏rk sjokolade.>
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Rund s√∏tlig, kaffe, m√∏rk sjokolade og vanilje.

the aroma is caramel and chocolate with hints of port, coconut, vanilla, toffee and dark fruits... the taste is chocolate and caramel with notes of sweet wine, coconut, vanilla, toffee and some dried fruits... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste... very nice porter...

Bottle (bonus B-day beer) from Savure Biere cons 2016-02-10 Gbg
AR: fat bourbon, vanilla, choco
AP: another black one, stouty thick fairly high black body/lid steady
F: smooth body, sweet, sugary mouthfeeling, bourbon vanilla, oak, brown chocolate, choco - milk chocolate, wee fudge, sweet but dry

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2016 Almost forgot to rate his one- although 2015 one of top beers. 
Beautiful, well rounded, full bodied, rich dark malts and caramel character with incident touch of wooden. So mellowed, silky/syrupy, dangerously next sip inviting. From George! differs with more gentle dark malts character and more gentle, silky mouth-feel.

Bottled. Pours black with an average, creamy and lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, hops, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and bourbon. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry with alcohol and a little bitterness. Medium  to full bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A great strong Porter.vüåüüåüüåüüåü

330 ml bottle from Gallagher¬ís Beer World/El Irland√©s. Wow, this is a rare beer! Pours a murky and viscous black color that lets no light pass through and a small khaki head that diminishes quickly into a nice lacing. Incredible aroma, roasted, malty and woody with marvelous balance. Notes of wood and vanilla dominate in the beginning, leading to dense character of cocoa, tabacco, bourbon, black olives, licorice and truffles. Quite fruity after some warming with hints of blueberries, dates, plums, prunes and molasses in high amounts. This would probably age in a fantastic way. Taste is quite sweet but more mellow and spicy than the non barreled version. The sweetness seems to be balanced by not overpowering vanilla/wood notes and more well-defined cocoa. Vanilla, cocoa, bourbon, Irish coffee and dark fruits are the dominant flavors. Big, chewy body, full mouthfeel. Carbonation is soft but lets itself be felt. This one is a sipper and a warmer. Nice alcoholic presence as a clear bourbon touch. Well balanced. Excellent. I still think the Brian series would benefit from less sweetness and a more bitter/roasted profile. That¬ís why George! is a superior beer both in the regular and barreled version. Anyway, this one is still a good sparring that might land a couple of punches on that other monstrous rival.

330 ml. bottle shared / split by 2. Black, small mocha bubbles. Nose is faint varnish with huge bourbon, molasses, vanilla, oak & chocolate syrup. Taste is phenomenal really, sweet chocolate, vanilla, thick chocolate cereal, very sweet coffee, sugar, caramel, sugary warming vanilla sugar bourbon, such a thick & syrupy treat with a massive chocolate cereal with bourbon taste, thick creamy with chocolate truffle. Really expensive but wow is this also good, wonderful to put it mildly pure chocolate cereal & bourbon goodness.

Pour pretty darn black (not pitch black tho), with a small dark beige head, that quickly fades to nothing.
Aroma really takes me back to the time of drinking a whole lot of Mikkeller beers, and when I first got into Bourbon Ba. Stouts. 
Aroma has quite a lot going on. Plenty of toasted malts, vanilla, plenty of bourbon, light dark tobacco, dark fruits, molasses, burnt sugar. 
Taste is quite sweet up front, with a rather heavy dose of roasted bitterness from the middle and throughout. Weak notes of something a bit harsh somewhere in here. 
Semi-full bodied, with a somewhat flat carbonation.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Mikkeller Brian BA Bourbon ].Clear dark dark black brown color with a small to average, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, vanilla, alcohol - bourbon. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, chocolate, sweet malt, bourbon, alcohol, dark malt, vanilla. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20151024]

330ml bottle courtesy of skullgeorge at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Black color with brown head. Malty aroma, roasted, chocolate, licorice, caramel, fruits, berries, dark dried fruits, vanilla, wood, alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full silky body with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a jet black body with a large cloudy light beige head. Nose is peanuts, wood, cocoa, vanilla, pecan nuts, chocolate, coffee and hints of caramel, dark malts and licorice. Taste is bourbon, wood, vanilla, pecan nuts, caramel, coffee, licorice and hints of peanuts, alcohol, burnt toast and nougat. Full, creamy body, medium to soft carbonation. A hefty, well-balanced and highly tasty imperial stout from the Mikkeller family of brewers. Smooth stuff.

Bottle. Frothy off-white good mostly deminishing head. Black colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Strong bourbon-vanilla notes. Long moderate biter finish. Creamy palate.
Black beer. Has a light brown head, diminishing. Aroma is black too, roasted, burnt sugars, barrel-notes. Flavor is heavy sweet, more burnt sugars.

Bottle. Pours a viscous black body with a medium dark tanned head. Aroma is heavy bourbon, roasted malts and sweet molasses. Taste is bourbon and roast. Sweet but not overly. Hints of wood and molasses. Warming finish with some alcohol and more bourbon.

Bottle @ Johns. Pours black with a small light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, dark chocolate, wood, bourbon, vanilla. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, dark chocolate, light coconut, vanilla wood, bourbon, light alcohol. Full body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with warming alcohol. 241015
heavy sweet alcoholic finish,black, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, chocolate, coffee, wood, vanilla, bourbon, fruits and hops. Nice bitter and full bodied.

Bottle, 12.3%. Black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, liquorice and vanilla. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, little liquorice, little harsh, wood, oak, warming, notes of alcohol and medium bitter.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla and bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily and smooth. 241015

Bottle (33cl) from Vinmonopolet (Aker brygge), Oslo. Black oil colour, small dark beige head that reduces fast and leaves a thin ring. Impressive, boozy aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, soy sauce, licorice, bourbon, lactose. Full body, oily mouthfeel, soft/flat carbonation. Sweet taste with gradually growing bitterness, leading to a woody, dry and pleasantly acidic finish with raw licorice and bitter chocolate.

From de bierkoning July 15.
Looks .. Used up Oil black/brown.. Sml brown head
Smells.. Heavy roasted malts, coffee, liquorice and bourbon.. A little oak.
Tastes.. a little choc and liquorice, but mostly coffee and bourbon.. Wow what a porter! (Imperial porter) .. Drinks like a BA imp stout.

Bottle a home bought, De Bierkonig. 28th August 15, shit the bed this is good. Pours deepest thickest black, not much head. Aroma is liquorice, bourbon. Taste is bitter chocolate, liquorice, some bourbon, never too sweet. Complex. Palate is thick and rich. Good linger. Great Impy!

Bottled at craft republic. As dark as oil, coffee coloured head. Reach malty aroma with chocolade, coffe and some vanilla. Very intensive sweet malty taste with super full body. Vanilla bourbon and roasted malt biterness on finish. Great beer!

33 cl bottle. Nearly pitch black with a mocha coloured head. Sweet aroma with bourbon, coffee and chocolate. Taste of bourbon, malt, syrup, coffe and chocolate; thick mouthfeel with a long bittersweet finish.

Botella 33 cl en el momento en oviedo el 07-08-2015. De cervezalandia. (r20). Color negro intenso con espuma oscura que desaparece por completo al poco tiempo. Aromas maltas tostadas intensas con toques de cacao algo de caf√© y maderas de bourbon y licor. Sabores intensos de maltas tostadas algo carbonizados con buenas dosis de cacaos especias vainilla y maderas con toques de licor y bourbon que no sobresalen en exceso. Cuerpo intenso denso pastoso y con algo de espuma en boca. 12.3 vol maravillosos q se notan en todo momento. Grand√≠sima cerveza. Para repetir sin duda.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2016 100 ml sample. Sweet, roasty with lots of dried fruit, big grassy bitterness and possibly some smoke. A touch of alcohol, some whisky? Big and bold, yet smooth and easy drinking. Excellent.

How: Bottle.
Where: From rlgk and Aniela, thanks.
Appearance: Black colour with a minimal beige head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, some liquorice.
Body: Full body, low carbonaiton.
Flavour: Roasted malt, chocolate, some liquorice, dried fruit, a bit vinous, caramel, alcohol.

150620. Bottle. Black beer with an brownish head. Roasted chocolate, bourbon vanilla licorice and tar aroma with some Woody notes. Roasted, licorice dark chocolate dark fruits caramell and some Woody flavour. Nice one :-)

Bottle shared. Pours near black with a medium beige head. Aroma of massive vanilla, bourbon, oak, chocolate, molasses, fudge and toffee. Flavour is heavy sweet. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Awesome!

Awesome brew. Intense roasted malts, even burned, huge dark choco profile, coffee, vanilla, wood, boost by BA gives another dimension of complexity, tho I couldnt get exactly a bourbon - for me it felt more like cognac/calvados edition. Some backdoor dark fruits, dried fruits. 
Moderate sweetness with moderate bitterness, light tartness.
Feels very smooth. Loved this one even tho I was quite wasted

08.07.2015, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is rich, dark malts, mild bourbon, grass, dark sugar, oak, minerals, caramel, vanilla, burnt coffee. Taste is sweet and slightly sour-ish boozy, sugar, oak, dark malts, bourbon, grass, minerals, sour coffee, vanilla, dark sour fruits, licorice. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly sour-ish boozy mouthfeel. Nice, but not even close to knocking out George. It¬ís quite the opposite actually; George knocks Brian far down in the shoes....

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown, almost black with a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, bourbon, and dark fruits - with a slightly bitter finish.

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Opaque black beer with a quite nice brownish head. Roasted chocolate and bourbon aroma, vanilla, cocoa, tar, licorice notes, nutcreme, caramel, some woody notes. Roasted licorice and vinous flavor, soot, cocoa, raisins, dark chocolate, plums, caramel, warming alcohol. Full bodied and with alcohol well used in the beer.

Opaque sombre. Pointue en bouche. Piquante mais pas agressive plut√¥t ronde ( le vieillissement ? ) Plus sur le Toffee que sur le chocolat ou le caf√©.
Bien, tr√®s bien sauf le prix ...

bottle sample from 33cl bottle, poured a darker black colour with a beige head. strong bourbon barrel notice, roasted malts, chocolate, almonds, vanilla, smoke, licorice, fudge, dark red fruits in the back, bitter ashy aftertaste. very nice

Bottle. It pours jet black with a creamy brown head. The aroma is high roasted with light ashy notes among the oaky bourbon notes. Creamy texture. Sweet roasted flavor with coffee and bourbon notes. Good hoppy.

Bottle enjoyed at Mikkeller and Friends in Reykjavik. Dark brown pour with a light brown head. Plenty of bourbon barrel on the nose. Loads of chocolate, fudge, and caramel. Complex with dark roasted malts, oak, vanilla, muted anise, and mellow bourbon notes. Rich, complex, and damn tasty. Really good body and mouthfeel.

18h April 2015 Opaque dark brown beer, tidy tan head. Nice mild fruity bourbon nose. Palate is soft and airy, mild fine carbonation. Smooth dark malts, rich but with a light creamy sweetness. Lovely mellow dark chocolate. The bourbon is smooth and wonderfully fruity and slightly tangy. Smooth finish. Sumptuous and very drinkable. Hope we get further BA Brian¬ís!

Bottle. Shared at Dangerous Bottle Share 8.0. Pitch black pour with tiny lacings. Nose has some sweet roast, malty sweet, coffee and some licorice. Taste has roast, bourbon notes, vanilla fudge, caramel, some savory notes and hints of licorice.

Shared at Dangerous Bottleshares #8. Pours a pitch black with a big brown head. Aroma has a fruity cofee, licorice, some bourbon, sugar, vanilla, dark chocolate, light tobacco. Taste is pretty sweet, dark chocolate, light tobacco-like smoke, raisins, roast, bitter notes, dry woody finish.

Bottle shared @ dangerous bottleshare #8. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is rather roasted with some coffee notes, vanilla, liquorice and some additional bourbon notes. The taste is rather roasted and savory with notes of roasted malts, coffee, liquorice and dry wood. I guess I prefer the original but this is still very good!

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #8. Pours a pitch black with a big, brown, dense head. Aroma has a fruity cofee, roasty malts, licorice, bourbon, burned sugar. Taste is pretty sweet up front, slight smoke, some roasty bitterness, oaky dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation. Not a competitor to george, but still quite nice!

33 cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma is vanilla, dark chocolate and caramelish. Mild sourish, vanilla, sweet, dark malty. Overripe fruity to slight citric. Vanilla and dense dark malty. Smooth rasted malty and chocolate malty finish.

Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Pitch black - brown head.
High malty. High burned malts. Nice mellow bourbon. Dark chocolate. Vanilla. Dry burned malts. Tarmac. Light herbal notes. Sweet notes. Dry finish.
